support_summary: SQSTM1 (p62) is an autophagy adapter that physically interacts with ATXN3 and co-localizes in protein aggregates (Co-IP evidence).

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 interacts with the autophagy adapter p62 (SQSTM1) to coordinate the sorting of ubiquitinated proteins into aggregates for autophagic degradation.
functions.effect_description: The interaction facilitates the selective clearance of protein inclusions.
biological_consequence: p62 Binding → Cargo Recognition → Selective Autophagy
specific_effects: Co-localization of ATXN3 and p62 in aggregates

evidence.paper_title: Interactions of ataxin-3 with its molecular partners in the protein machinery that sorts protein aggregates to the aggresome

mechanism: ATXN3 interacts with the autophagy adapter p62 (SQSTM1) to coordinate the sorting of ubiquitinated proteins into aggregates for autophagic degradation.
effect: The interaction facilitates the selective clearance of protein inclusions.
summary: ATXN3 activates SQSTM1 to modulate protein aggregate clearance, ultimately affecting selective autophagy.

evidence.paper_title: Interactions of ataxin-3 with its molecular partners in the protein machinery that sorts protein aggregates to the aggresome

initial_pathway.reasoning: ATXN3 interacts with the autophagy adapter p62/SQSTM1 to promote the degradation of ubiquitinated proteins via selective autophagy.
